intro: Oxydectes adenocalyx, commonly known as the red-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features dense, evergreen foliage with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its most distinctive characteristic is its clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Oxydectes adenocalyx thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
